title: Ticket #2051: SecMan completely broken if configured with -DWITH_OPENSSL:BOOL=OFF
description:
If condor is built with openssl disabled (via cmake -DWITH_OPENSSL:BOOL=OFF ), Condor_Crypt_Base::oneWayHashKey() fails, causing SecMan::CreateNonNegotiatedSecuritySession() to fail, causing DaemonCore::Create_Process() to fail, as well. Bad things happen.

Currently, we have this chunk of DaemonCore::Create_Process() disabled (via #ifndef SOLARIS for Solaris, so we're not encountering this problem on Solaris x86 / x86/64 (for which we don't have openssl) ).
